title: Season 3 Veterans... do you remember when EVERYTHING was broken?
body:
Do u remember when {{champion:17}}  shrooms could 1 shot an adc?
Do you remember when {{champion:76}} spears could 1 shot {{champion:17}} ?
Do you remember when {{champion:67}} was voted most likely to get a penta-kill but no one cared because you could 1 shot her with full tank
{{champion:107}} ?

Do you remember when your "awesome support" 5X honors would win a game by putting one of these {{item:2044}} over every square inch of the map?
Do u remember when you could carry a game just by ganking because your enemys didnt have a free {{item:3340}}?

Do you remember when {{champion:120}} ult felt like an actual cavalry charge?
Do you remember when {{champion:24}} could 1 vs 5 with 2 items?
Do you remember when {{champion:75}} had a 99% attack speed slow?
Do you remember when {{champion:7}}  had a silence yet no one played her?

DO YOU REMEMBER THAT THE GAME WAS ACTUALLY MORE FUN BACK THEN??? {{champion:35}}

replies.body: 65% win rate Talon. League of Cleavers, never forget. I'm not sure what was worse, that or League of Bork.
Pepperidge Farm remembers.
The teemo shrooms were hands down my favorite. You could actually ~~0-100~~ 100-0 someone with 1 shroom if you built correctly, especially on 3v3.
...you could revive them from death and heal them back up to full health?

> [{quoted}](name=360D3GR3SS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGNtwYEJ,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-02-20T01:59:42.846+0000)
>
> The teemo shrooms were hands down my favorite. You could actually ~~0-100~~ 100-0 someone with 1 shroom if you built correctly, especially on 3v3.

When did teemo shrooms get nerfed? There hasnt been a teemo nerf since season 2 theyve only buffed him? Or are you referring to how nobody plays him because its not that fun anymore? because the rest of the champs just one shot him?
They lowered the ratio of his shrooms from 80% AP to 50% AP.

Ap {{champion:96}}  was a competitive pick

Ap {{champion:42}}  was wreking solo-q

Ap {{champion:236}}  could do over 13,000 damage with his ult
AP Lucian was nerfed before he was even released. You clearly have a spotty memory.

Season 3? Hah

I remember when {{champion:56}} could gank from the middle of the jungle.
I remember when {{champion:58}} owned the top lane.
I remember when {{champion:36}} went where he pleased.
I remember when {{champion:119}} took over the League.
And perhaps best of all, I remember Force of Nature and Ionic Spark.

Season two forever.

HoG and Kage's on Leona. Soloing bot lane because nobody paid attention to the meta.
Free Silver.
S2 represent.
{{item:3070}} I miss HoG
Right there with you. It was a staple buy whenever I played volibear. I would buy a ruby crystal as a first item to rush for the HoG; had 847 starting hp, it was lovely.
Season 2 will forever be my favourite season.

When {{champion:38}}  was banned all game every game
When {{champion:79}}  two shot people
When {{champion:85}}  was viable
When {{champion:22}} was a competitive pick
When {{champion:92}}  was Super broken
When {{champion:98}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:4}} was a viable team comp
When {{summoner:21}} was better than {{summoner:7}}

> [{quoted}](name=Packerfan504,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGNtwYEJ,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2015-02-20T04:25:50.921+0000)
>
> When {{champion:38}}  was banned all game every game
> When {{champion:79}}  two shot people
> When {{champion:85}}  was viable
> When {{champion:22}} was a competitive pick
> When {{champion:92}}  was Super broken
> When {{champion:98}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:4}} was a viable team comp
> When {{summoner:21}} was better than {{summoner:7}}

Riven still is SUPER strong today.
She was *Better*
Aaaaaand...... let that sink in.

Everyone putting on their rose-tinted goggles again. Ranged tops dominated, Jayce and Diana were in every single game and were disgustingly OP, and  many of the shitty champions of today were still shitty back then.

Also, supporting was a torture. At that time, there was no trinket, and there were oracles. If your team was behind, the other team's support just had to get an Oracle, and you can say bye bye to all wards. Also, you got flamed if you did not keep 5 wards on the map at all times. Having to buy 2 gp10 items just to be able to keep buying wards and oracles. 

I remember when in competitive, most supports would only get boots + sightstone. Personally, I really enjoy Season 5 because of how well Riot has balanced the supporting role & how you can actually afford many items; now, with the buffed yellow trinket, keeping the map fully warded is a lot easier.

I do remember supporting sucked. But it meant that those of us who mained support were actually appreciated. And keeping the map fully warded is impossible now, since i can only place 4 wards max, instead of the 5-6 I'd like to have to keep an eye on the bot half of the map. (Lane bush, Blue Tri, Drag pit, Ramp bush, Purple-side Blue bush, and behind dragon pit.)
Nooooo way. I feel WAY more appreciated now than before. Before we actually had a problem of being way underappreciated, now people just think we're underappreciated when we aren't.

Jayce?   Diana?  

You mean Kennen and Vladimir?
diana was mid then in the jungle. Jayce was top then mid. Kennen was played a lot. Vlad not so much.

> [{quoted}](name=KYU22,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGNtwYEJ,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2015-02-20T04:44:28.803+0000)
>
> Everyone putting on their rose-tinted goggles again. Ranged tops dominated, Jayce and Diana were in every single game and were disgustingly OP, and  many of the shitty champions of today were still shitty back then.

but it was funnier

i mean...20 minute game, firstblood and carry that shit 1vs5

nowadays you need 30-40 mins to win a game...
Vouch, shaco was the pinnacle of fun.
I'm pretty sure Nidalee can still 1-shot a Teemo tho.
Lies, a lot of what OP said is bs.

> [{quoted}](name=Tang Bohu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGNtwYEJ,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-02-20T03:33:04.389+0000)
>
> Lies, a lot of what OP said is bs.

You must not have been around in season 3. It was actually more rediculous than what i mentioned.

I didn't even get to tear stacking {{champion:126}} and  AP {{champion:236}} .

I was there, this post is BS. People frequently proclaimed it the "worst time for balance in League history"

AP Lucian never even made it to live, they nerfed the ratio on his ult before his release.

While there are definitely some issues in this season, our current problems aren't on the same level of severity as the ones in previous seasons. On one hand, full tanks aren't really viable now, but on the other we had an entire season where a single class of champions (bruisers) became so overpowered with a single build (the Metagolem) that they could literally do everything every other class specialized in better than those champions themselves. We no longer have the old {{champion:14}} , who had one of the most toxic kits in the game, and we're no longer in a state where the only items supports are allowed to build are gold per 10 items and an inventory full of {{item:2043}} . As much as there's still tons of stuff that needs improvement, League as a game has become progressively better.

As a season 1 veteran, you know not the definition of broken.

5 turret {{champion:74}} that could nade towers

{{champion:86}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3111}} Nevar forget

{{champion:82}} in a *strong* state. Not just viable, *strong.*

{{champion:24}} release lololololololololol. Dodge towers and passive over 100% dodge lololololol.

{{champion:44}} when his ult healed *the entire team*.

{{champion:40}} when rushing {{item:3041}} on her was viable *every game*, even as a support. Goddess slut of Assists.

League *PRE*-Tribunal. Oh god, community OP PLZ NERF.
---
I've seen some *shit*, man. I'm actually kinda glad some of that is behind us.

I remember people complain about balance, and saying that Riot had no idea what they were doing, and that the game was doomed.

>Do u remember when {{champion:17}}  shrooms could 1 shot an adc?
Do you remember when  {{champion:76}} spears could 1 shot ?

No I don't, because that never happened in a realistic game out of Bronze 5/Blind Pick.

>Do you remember when {{champion:120}}  ult felt like an actual cavalry charge?

His ult has barely been changed. I think they moved some damage around.

> [{quoted}](name=killd0zer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGNtwYEJ,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-02-20T04:09:50.380+0000)
>
> I remember people complain about balance, and saying that Riot had no idea what they were doing, and that the game was doomed.
> Do you remember when  {{champion:76}} spears could 1 shot ?
> 
> No I don't, because that never happened in a realistic game out of Bronze 5/Blind Pick.
> 
> His ult has barely been changed. I think they moved some damage around.

You dont even know what you are talking about kid.

Teemos shrooms used to be on a 0.8 ratio with 600 base damage at one point.  He was so strong that he litterally did not have to teamfight because his shrooms would end up turning teamfights around in seconds.

Hecarims ult used to have both charge damage and impact damage, and his W used to proc true damage from the lizard elder. 

... oh and it used to heal him of 30% damage and have a shorter cd ROFL rito pls!

>Teemos shrooms used to be on a 0.8 ratio with 600 base damage at one point.

Yep and it was never 1 shotting people, unless he was like 8 levels above everyone else. 1k AP (which he would never have) would make his ult 1400 dmg, before MR. 

>Hecarims ult used to have both charge damage and impact damage

...your point? It did 200 more damage at max rank. That doesn't single handily change the fundamental playstyle or feel of a champ.

And I probably wouldn't try to act high and mighty "knowing what I'm talking about" when you said AP Lucian was ever a thing. That was nerfed within 2 weeks BEFORE HE WAS RELEASED.

>failtard 

sure showed me

>i'm right, you are wrong

fuck I lose

He deleted it, but it said something along the lines of "Lol I'm just making a fun post, you're a over-analyzing fail tard. Doesn't matter what you say cus I'm right and you are wrong. Have a nice life KEK"
That post of OP's just showed us his immaturity.

thats what someone called the dota ballance
i didnt pla dota much, but they guy said that in dota every champion has his way of becoming op, so in the end the game is about interaction beetwen champions who have insanely diferent ways of fighting and compeeting into the game 
while in lol champions do the same things so the one who gets ahead does everything better than his lane opponent

Let's take a look at Kassadin. Kassadin's core identity and huge strength is his R. People complain about Kassadin being OP
What does RIOT do? Nerf his R.
What does DotA do? Buff his R and nerf the rest of his kit.
What does RIOT achieve? Homogenize the game and make every champion feel the same when they are played.
What does DotA achieve? A roster of heroes that are ridiculously strong on their own field but no one is really "better" since every hero has his own hyper-strength.
And yes, it's true that there are heroes that are played more in DotA2 too, but that's just because the community tends to feel more comfortable with these heroes' mechanics, and they aren't played "as much more than the rest" than Top-tier League's champions. Almost every hero in DotA has still a niche in competitive playing.

Don't get me wrong, I like League and it's still the game I play the most by far, but I have to admit that I like DotA's balance policy much more.

Nope, sorry..didn't ring any bell. Because i'm a Season 2 Veteran, i remember when {{champion:82}} still an "immovable object". i remember when {{champion:86}} 's W and E is such a plague for the top lane, i remember when everyone fight each other during Champion's pick for top lane {{champion:122}} , i remember when {{champion:15}} pushes minion's waves like a fckin hurricane, i remember when {{champion:81}} is a mid lane Champ, i remember when "FORCE OF NATURE" can make {{champion:54}} like an angry bulldozer, well there are a lot of things i remember about this AMAZING game.
Ezreal is being played mid in the LCS today.

Season 3 was my first season actively playing with fully understanding of the game (I was there since Season 1 but I couldn't play and I could just watch games on streaming). And I miss it. I remember when some pro said that Diana was the best champion in the game. I remember Master Yi full AP. When they buffed LeBlanc's R because she was considered useless. When everybody was complaining about Darius. When you could actually play a classic mage without being stomped by a free-mobility champion. When Yasuo did not existed. When I enjoyed playing DFG-full-AP-Malphite. When people considered "broken mids" to Lux and Yi AP instead of Zed and Zed. When Nautilus was considered god-tier jungler...

I wonder if we'll see Nautilus being god-tier again.

Really, I compare competitive playing from Season 1/2 to Season 2015 and I want to cry D:
{{champion:38}} Remember him, when he was an auto ban?

I remember when Morgana was banned. I remember Ionic Spark, Madred's Bloodrazor, Malady, and Force of Nature. I remember when TF, Morg, and others did not have their texture updates.

I remember.
And I miss it.
Morgana's textures are much better now D:

If you thought black cleaver was bad you weren't around for sunfire or revolver/gunblade stacking back in season 1

Revolver gave 20% spellvamp and stacked, gunblade gave 25% spellvamp and 20% lifesteal and stacked etc

> [{quoted}](name=FalconPawwwwnch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGNtwYEJ,comment-id=0037,timestamp=2015-02-20T17:54:17.815+0000)
>
> If you thought black cleaver was bad you weren't around for sunfire or revolver/gunblade stacking back in season 1

Season 2 and 3.  {{item:3072}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3046}}  {{item:3046}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3035}}  best ADC build.  RIP Bloodthirster.
